72501.name: Rolan's Curse
72501.description:
From the back of the box:

ROLAN'S CURSE

After centuries in captivity, King Barius, Lord of the Demons, has escaped. In his fury he has cursed the peaceful land of Rolan. Hordes of dark creatures roam free in the countryside. A desperate cry goes out...are there any warriors brave enough to free the people from the curse?

From Wikipedia:
"Like Nintendo's Zelda adventure series, the player goes from screen to screen and defeats enemies with a sword while finding items from monsters and treasure chests. The player is allowed two items at a time: one weapon and one sub-item; picking up a different weapon or sub will switch out the current one. The character starts with a sword but can find a fire wand that deals ranged attacks at the sacrifice of attack power. Other items include a hammer for breaking down barriers and a potion for restoring all health. The player can also pick up another of the currently equipped weapon to gain a temporary boost to attack power, or an armor jacket to raise defense temporarily. These temporary boosts return to normal after a level is beaten. More permanent power-ups come in the form of strength gloves and heart containers, which upgrade attack and defense respectively.

The game can also be played with another player if the two individuals link their Game Boys together while the game is inserted."

Source: Wikipedia, "Rolan's_Curse," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

72502.name: Tokimeki Memorial Girl's Side
72502.description:
User summary (with release information from Japanese Wikipedia):

A boy-dating high-school romance simulation game from Konami. The player takes the role of a girl entering high school, where she meets several attractive boys. The goal of the game is to have one of the boys confess his love for the player as the three years of high school comes to an end.

Each week, the player can choose what to concentrate on: studies, exercise, socializing and so on, activities that will raise and lower various stats. Depending on the player's stats, random encounters with certain boys will occur, and once the player knows the name of a boy, she can invite him to dates.

The game was ported to Nintendo DS in 2007, and got a full-voiced version in 2009.

Source: Wikipedia, "ときめきメモリアル_Girl%27s_Side," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

72503.name: Castlevania
72503.description:
"Castlevania, known in Japan as Akumajou Dracula (悪魔城ドラキュラ, Devil's Castle Dracula), is a console video game developed and published by Konami for the Family Computer Disk System in Japan in September 1986. A year later, in May 1987 it was ported to cartridge format and released in North America for the Nintendo Entertainment System (NES) followed by a European release in 1988. It was re-released for the Family Computer in cartridge format in Japan in 1993. It is the first game in Konami's Castlevania video game series.

The player takes control of Simon Belmont in the year 1691, who must defeat the vampire Dracula. A sequel, Simon's Quest, was released for the NES a few years later."

Source: Wikipedia, "Castlevania_(video_game)," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

72504.name: Summer Carnival '92: Recca
72504.description:
[User Summary]

Recca, a vertical shmup for the Japanese Famicom, was released and sold exclusively during the 1992 Naxat Soft "Summer Carnival" video game competition. It is often called one of the best shooters for the system and one of the most technically impressive games for Nintendo's first home console. It is also considered extremely difficult due to the extreme speed and high number of enemies on screen at once. Because of its scarcity and perceived quality gameplay, Recca frequently sells for very high prices in the second hand market.

A soundtrack CD is also available, which demands a high price as well.

72505.name: Little Nemo: The Dream Master
72505.description:
"Little Nemo: The Dream Master (known as Pajama Hero Nemo (パジャマヒーロー NEMO, Pajama Hiirou Niimou) in Japan) is a platform game released on the NES in 1990 by Capcom. It is based on the Japanese animated film, Little Nemo: Adventures in Slumberland from Tokyo Movie Shinsha, which itself is based on the comic strip Little Nemo in Slumberland by Winsor McCay. The game's music was composed by Junko Tamiya, credited in the game as "Gonzou".

The game revolves around a small boy in his own surreal dreams as he journeys to Slumberland. Nemo can ride certain animals such as a frog, a gorilla, or a mole, by feeding them candy. Each animal has its own skills needed to complete each level. The purpose of the game is to travel to the Nightmare land to rescue Morpheus, the king of Slumberland, from the clutches of the evil Nightmare King."

Source: Wikipedia, "Little_Nemo:_The_Dream_Master," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

72506.name: Kirby's Adventure
72506.description:
"Kirby's Adventure, (in Japan: 星のカービィ夢の泉の物語, Hoshi no Kaabii Yume no Izumi no Monogatari, lit. "Kirby of the Stars: The Story of the Fountain of Dreams"), is a platforming video game developed by HAL Laboratory and published by Nintendo for the Nintendo Entertainment System video game console.

Kirby's Adventure is the only Nintendo Entertainment System Kirby video game, and is the second game in the Kirby series, following his debut on the Game Boy in Kirby's Dream Land. It is also the first Kirby game on a home console, to be in color, and to have a save feature. It also features the first appearance of the popular character Meta Knight.

The original version has been released on the Virtual Console in North America on February 12, 2007, in Europe on February 16, 2007, and in Japan on February 27, 2007."

Source: Wikipedia, "Kirby's_Adventure," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

72507.description:
Take the helm of a small shipping company, deliver valuable cargo and out-sell your opponents! You face an exciting challenge to bring your fledgling company up to speed with the changing demands across the region.


Anchorage is a fast moving strategy game where you build factories, create high-speed shipping routes and devise tactics to make sure you deliver the most valuable cargo. Steer your merchant ship to take advantage of the high tides, and weather the impact of the low tides in order to prevail. The region can only support one company in the long term so you have a lot to prove!


No game of Anchorage is the ever the same, due to the interchangeable tiles which allow different game-board layouts and the ever-changing demands of the ports.


This game is available from arcticfoxgames.com. Limited copies will be available at the UK Games Expo 2013.
72507.name: Anchorage

72508.name: Go With The Flow
72508.description:
A ship loaded with treasure has been wrecked near your island.

Whirlpools, storms and sharks lie amongst the changing currents between your island and the wreck. Instruct your pirates to build rafts and salvage treasure from the wreck or steal it by attacking other player's rafts!

This is a quick tile turning game suitable for 2-4 players from age 8.

(Publisher Blurb, Copyright 2011)

72509.name: Icebomb Arena
72509.description:
Icebomb Arena is a strategy game of gladiatorial combat in a bomb-laden arena for 4 or more players. Each player is a gladiator in the arena. Icebomb Arena is played with Icehouse pyramids on a chessboard.

Each turn consists of a planning phase and an action phase. During the planning phase, players will determine the orientation of pyramids which will determine the actions they can take during the action phase. During the action phase, each player will take two actions either blocking or moving on the board.

The goal is to be the last player with a gladiator on the board that has health. The players can lose health through fights with other gladiators and through stepping on squares that have bombs.

videogamecompilation: The Elder Scrolls III: Morrowind – Game of the Year Edition
videogame: The Elder Scrolls III: Morrowind – Game of the Year Edition
72510.description:
"The Elder Scrolls III: Bloodmoon is the second expansion pack for Bethesda Softworks' The Elder Scrolls III: Morrowind. While it was originally released as an expansion set for Microsoft Windows, Bloodmoon is included within the Morrowind: Game of the Year edition for Microsoft Windows.

Unlike the first expansion Tribunal, which added a city separate from the world map consisting of interior cells, Bloodmoon adds a large new island to the original world map, a cold northern territory named Solstheim. Rather than the Dunmer (dark elves) that are the indigenous race in the nearby Vvardenfell, Solstheim is populated largely by the Nord race. This is largely because the island sits more or less astride the border between Morrowind and the Nord homeland of Skyrim.

This expansion adds new enemies, the East Empire Company as a joinable guild, and the possibility to become a werewolf, akin to the inclusion of vampires seen in Morrowind. Bloodmoon also uses larger and more detailed environments, including snowfall, thus raising the computer hardware requirements, though the ash storms of the original game are much more graphically demanding than the snow of Bloodmoon.

As with Morrowind and Tribunal, Bloodmoon has many side-quests to finish and many caves to explore aside from its main quest. Unlike Tribunal, which is intended to be played after the completion of Morrowind's main-quest, Bloodmoon's main-quest is self-contained within the expansion."

Source: Wikipedia, "The_Elder_Scrolls_III:_Bloodmoon," available under the CC-BY-SA License.
72510.name: The Elder Scrolls III: Bloodmoon

72511.name: An Elder Scrolls Legend: Battlespire
72511.description:
"An Elder Scrolls Legend: Battlespire is a 1997 first-person action computer role-playing game developed and published by Bethesda Softworks, set in the world of The Elder Scrolls.
In Battlespire the player takes the role of an apprentice who on the day of his final test in the training facility of the Battlemages, called the Battlespire, discovers that an army of Daedra led by Mehrunes Dagon has invaded and killed nearly everyone. On top of that, your partner has been held captive by Mehrunes Dagon himself. Over the course of seven levels, you must travel through various realms of Oblivion to reach Mehrunes Dagon, defeat him and escape back to Tamriel.

Bethesda introduced a multiplayer feature that included a cooperative mode to follow the single player storyline online as well as a team-based versus mode to fight using all the same strategies from the single player. This was done through the Mplayer multiplayer network which is now GameSpy."

Source: Wikipedia, "An_Elder_Scrolls_Legend:_Battlespire," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

72512.name: Icehouse Plant Game
72512.description: The Icehouse Plant Game is an Icehouse Pyramid game played inside a loop of string. Each player controls a plant that is trying to grow while blocking all of the light energy from the other players' plants. The more energy your plant can collect, the bigger it can grow, but you must be careful not to grow so fast that you kill your leaves.

72513.name: Dead Space
videogamefranchise: EA Value Games (Best Selling Electronic Arts Games, PAL)
Greatest Hits (Best Selling PlayStation Games, US)
Platinum Hits (Best Selling Xbox 360 Games, US)
videogamehonor: 2008 Game Critics Best Action/Adventure Game of the Year Winner
2008 Game Critics Game of the Year Nominee
2008 Spike Best Action Adventure Game of the Year Nominee
2009 British Academy Game Awards Best Action/Adventure Game of the Year Nominee
2009 British Academy Game Awards Best Art Direction of the Year Nominee
2009 British Academy Game Awards Best Audio of the Year Winner
2009 British Academy Game Awards Best Soundtrack of the Year Winner
2009 D.I.C.E. Action Game of the Year Winner
2009 D.I.C.E. Best Art Direction of the Year Nominee
2009 D.I.C.E. Best Music Composition of the Year Nominee
2009 D.I.C.E. Best Sound Design of the Year Winner
2009 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Audio of the Year Winner
2012 D.I.C.E. Cellular/Mobile Game of the Year Nominee
72513.description:
[User Summary]

Dead Space is a third person science fiction survival horror game.

You play engineer Isaac Clarke who is part of a team sent to repair the USG Ishimura, a mining vessel that went out of contact shortly after uncovering an alien artifact. Upon arrival, you discover that the crew has been massacred and reanimated as horrific monsters who kill most of your team and cut you off from your ship. You must fight your way through these necromorphs and the hazards of the damaged spaceship to find a way to escape with your life.

Isaac is equipped with a space suit and some mining tools that serve as makeshift weapons, all of which may be upgraded as the game progresses.

The space setting provides some unique challenges including lack of oxygen and zero gravity combat in some areas. Your space suit provides you with oxygen tanks and gravity boots to help you deal with these, as well as giving you the abilities of stasis, allowing you to temporarily slow down machines and adversaries, and kinesis, allowing you to attract and repel objects remotely.

72514.name: Infinity: Human Sphere
72514.description: Infinity Human Sphere is an expansion to the Infinity tabletop miniatures skirmish game. This supplement contains rules for sectorial armies which have more limits on troop type selections but gain the ability to form “Link Troops” where entire squads act as one. Human Sphere contains new troop types, weapons, equipment, and skills for all of the factions as well as rules for using civilians in your games. In addition, the expansion introduces the new Aleph faction which features cybernetically advanced humans leading robotic remotes as base troops.

72515.name: NES-101
72515.description:
The NES-101 model of the Nintendo Entertainment System (informally known as the NES 2, the "top loading" model, or simply the "top loader") is a compact, top-loading redesign of the original Nintendo Entertainment System control deck and game controllers released by Nintendo in 1993.

Nintendo marketed the NES-101 model as the Nintendo Entertainment System Control Deck, exactly the same as the original NES-001 model, only with a "new design" logo on the packaging. It retailed in North America for US $49.99 (equivalent to US $75.00 today). This was at a significantly lower price point than the already released Super Nintendo Entertainment System. The NES-101 model is stylistically similar to the HVC-101 model of the Family Computer, which was released in Japan at roughly the same time, but differs in a number of its specifications.

Source: Wikipedia, "Nintendo Entertainment System (Model NES-101)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

72516.name: Twin Famicom
72516.description:
User summary, details from Wikipedia

The Twin Famicom, also called the Sharp Twin Famicom, is a game console licensed by Nintendo and built by Sharp combining the Family Computer and Family Computer Disk System into one product.

The console will not allow both systems to be run simultaneously. The user must toggle a switch to choose between the Famicom and the Disk System. Like the Family Computer, the controllers are wired to the system and cannot be removed without taking the console apart. The Disk System inside the Twin Famicom is identical to that in the original Disk System and suffers from the same hardware problems, primarily rotting disk belts.

There are several variations, ranging from minimal changes (color differences), to significant improvements (longer cords and turbo buttons for the controllers).

72517.name: Sega Nomad
72517.description:
The Sega Nomad (also called Sega Genesis Nomad or just Nomad) was a handheld game console sold for the North American consumer market which played Mega Drive/Genesis game cartridges. The system was similar to the Japanese Sega Mega Jet, but featured a built-in color screen; the Mega Jet needed a separate monitor. The Nomad was never officially released in PAL territories such as Europe and Australia, though the unit retained its PAL/NTSC switch on the internal board. It was released in Japan after a delay as the Mega Jet was already being sold in Japanese retail stores. The Nomad is one of the few Sega systems that can play most games regardless of region without an adapter. Its codename during development was Project Venus, as per Sega's policy at the time of codenaming their systems after planets.

Source: Wikipedia, "Sega Nomad", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

72521.name: Blaster Master
72521.description:
"Blaster Master is a platforming and run and gun video game released by Sunsoft for the Nintendo Entertainment System. It is a localized version of a Japanese Famicom game titled Chô Wakusei Senki Metafight (超惑星戦記メタファイト, which loosely translates to "Super Planetary War Records: Metafight") (also simply called MetaFight or Meta Fight).

The game features a character named Jason who follows his pet frog Fred down a hole in the earth. There he finds a tank and uses it to battle radioactive mutants. The player controls Jason and the tank SOPHIA THE 3RD through eight levels of gameplay to find the whereabouts of Fred and to defeat the mutants and their leader, the Plutonium Boss. The game was praised for its smooth play control and level designs, detailed and clean graphics, and music, and it was criticized for its high difficulty level and lack of passwords or save points. The game was novelized by Peter Lerangis, as part of the Worlds of Power series published by Scholastic Books."

Source: Wikipedia, "Blaster_Master," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

72522.name: Battlestations: Midway
72522.description:
[From the instruction manual]:

Battlestations: Midway represents a radical advance in naval war gaming. Now YOU can control and direct every aspect of naval warfare, with genre-defining control systems and strategic interactive maps.

From your early days captaining a wooden-hulled torpedo boat, your challenge is to advance through the ranks of the United States Navy to command the largest battleships and aircraft carriers of World War II. Ultimately, you will direct entire battle groups of ships and subs, as well as squadrons of aircraft, to strike against the jewels in the crown of the Japanese Navy.

This may sound like a tall order, but with training at the Naval Academy, you'll grow in skill and experience. With resolve, focus and determination—plus a little bit of luck—perhaps you can triumph against a deadly opponent, an enemy equipped with weaponry and units that equal those of the Allied forces.

The Pacific is at battlestations. Are you equal to the challenge?

72523.name: The Age of Dante: Montaperti and Campaldino
72523.description:
Simple, introductory wargame, first in the Postcards from Tuscany series, being a spin off of the Battles of Middle Ages system, from TCS Games.
It is a classic wargame with hex map, leader activation through chit draw, while a peculiarity is the fact that each unit has variable strength, according to a chit drawn before each combat (or once for the entire game).
It is a print & play only game, featuring 2 different battles from Italian Middle Ages: Montaperti and Campaldino.
Each game has a single A4 map and around 80 playing counters

72524.name: Dancing Blade
72524.description:
Translated from Japanese Wikipedia:

Dancing Blade is an multi-ending interactive animation from Konami. One play takes about 30 minutes, and the story changes according to the multiple-choice choices that the player selects.

The game was released for Playstation in 1998 and then Dreamcast, and lastly ported to the PSP in 2006.

Source: Wikipedia, "Dancing_Blade_かってに桃天使!," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

72525.name: Dancing Blade II – Tears of Eden
72525.description:
Translated from Japanese Wikipedia:

Dancing Blade II – Tears of Eden is the sequel to Dancing Blade, and is an multi-ending interactive animation from Konami. One play takes about 30 minutes, and the story changes according to the multiple-choice choices that the player selects.

The game was released for Playstation in 1999 and soon thereafter the Dreamcast.

Source: Wikipedia, "Dancing_Blade_かってに桃天使!," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

72527.name: Championship Rugby
72527.description:
“Championship Rugby” enables you to play an entire rugby tournament or season in only a few hours.

Individual players are not identified, but teams have dynamic Attack and Defence ratings which fluctuate over the season depending on form, injuries, suspensions or even the resignation of the team coach.

These ratings, plus home advantage and weather, determine the match ratings for the teams each week. Matches are then played out with two dice rolls per team per half, making it easy to generate half time scores for the full week’s fixture list before progressing to the second half of each match, if you wish.

“Championship Rugby” generates a statistically accurate campaign, whilst still maintaining that unpredictable aspect of sport.

72528.name: GURPS Meister der Sphären
72528.description:
THREE WORLDS ... JUST ONE ADVENTURE

It starts quiet harmless: A couple of friends meet for a GURPS-RPG-session. They want to get into an exiting adventure in the phantastic world of a new gamemaster.

And so they will - though different then they expected! Suddenly the gamers get in the world of endless opportunities ... ALL BYY THEMSELVES ... up into a game without frontiers.

First of all the gamers have to get through the hyborian world of CONAN, the barbarian, Where they have to fulfill an ancient prophecy. To find a magical jewel of might just before the enemy would do.
Only if the adventurers restrain their antagonist Deloth from setting the Mosaic Of Might together, they could get back to their origin wolrld.

But getting home gets quiet heavier then expected. Still on the search for further pieces of the Mosaic Of Might the adventurers have to get through the merciless future-world of CYBERPUNK. In the year 2020 they have to face the menace of High-Tech-Cyberspace and Low-Life-Urban-Jungle.

After that the story goes on in the world of classic horror. With demons and vampires. In a world of the 19th century, which Deloth has almost totally under his reign of terror.

Only if the gamers are up to the challenges of all three worlds, they could help to influence the fate of all spheres and boost the power of light.

This is the first German original GURPS-adventure-module.

The adventure "Meister der Sphären" (Lord of the spheres) shows a one-of-a-kind introduction of the possibilities and themes of the the GURPS-universal-rpg. It demonstrates one of the big potencies of GURPS - the easy way of switching from one rpg-genre into another. It's a fascinating turn from our present world to CONAN's fantasy world, high-tech-cyberpunk of the future, the gaslight-horror of the Victorian age, and back again.
There's not better way to learn about the multi-generic possibilities of GURPS.

(translated from the back-cover of "Meister der Sphären")

72529.name: Wonder Boy
videogameversion: English/European ZX Spectrum (The Hit Squad Re-release) edition
North American Sega Master System edition
72529.description:
User summary (details from Japanese Wikipedia):

A highly typical "right-scrolling action maneuver arcade" game from 1986. The main character is a prehistoric human supposed to save his sweet heart from monsters. The player jumps over boulders and throw stone axes at monsters, sometimes riding on a skateboard, trying to reach the stage end.

Wonder Boy was the first in a series of games with a lot of naming confusion. As the arcade was published by Sega, the game was ported to the SG-1000 and later Sega Mark III (Master System, here named "Super Wonder Boy" to separate from the SG1000 port), and several other 8-bit home systems, but Sega didn't allow for the name to be used for other ports. Westone still owned the code, and the game was ported to the Famicon under the name "Takahashi's Adventure Island" (in the West "Adventure Island) and published by Hudson Soft. This "Adventure Island" spawned a series in itself, but the first game was using the same code as the Wonder Boy game.

The Wonder Boy arcade game was sequelled by a unique arcade RPG adventure called "Wonder Boy in Monster Land", which also saw strange re-namings for the home ports. A third arcade, Monster Lair, shared the name "Wonder Boy III" with the "Dragon's Trap" Master System game only released in the West. See The Wonder Boy series entry for details.

Source: Wikipedia, "ワンダーボーイ_(ゲーム)," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

72530.name: Wonder Boy in Monster Land
videogameversion: North American Sega Master System edition
72530.description:
User summary, details from Japanese Wikipedia:

The sequel to Westone's arcade game Wonder Boy. In Wonder Boy Monster Land, the player stabs with his sword instead of throwing stone axes, gains money for defeating enemies and can buy new equipment in shops for the money he has gained, effectively introducing RPG elements in a platform arcade game. In order to be able to defeat the final boss (or find his weak spot), the player also had to follow a trail of clues which included searching for hidden doors and delivering objects to various characters in the game.

The game was ported to several home systems, and saw many renamings. The Mark III port was called Super Wonder Boy Monster World and so spawned a separate Westone game series: Monster World, in which this game was the first (while also being the second Wonder Boy game). As for Wonder Boy, Sega was the publisher and would not allow the title for other than Sega systems, but Westone owned the code and for the PC Engine port, the game was renamed "Bikkuriman World", and is by far the most faithful of all ports. Tectoy, the Brazilian distributor of Monster World changed the character graphics to create the game Mônica no Castelo do Dragão (based on characters from a brazilian comic) for the Master System. Also, an unlicensed version of Monster World was also produced for the Famicon, under the title of Saiyuki World, changing the character's graphics. This conversion was produced by Jaleco.

Trivia:
The western version of the arcade was translated by Japanese, and was at the time a bit famous for it's 'Engrish'. Lines such as "Defeat Dragon? If so, help you! My friend, Mary lives in Baraboro. Deliver this letter, help me!" are unfortunately unavailable in the more professionally translated contemporary ports.

Details source: Wikipedia, "モンスターワールドシリーズ," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

72531.name: Wastelands
72531.description:
User summary:

Wastelands is a Swedish post apocalypse role-playing game published in 1990. The game is set 30 years after an alien invasion from the aliens called Byrr.

The core book is dominated (approximately three quarters) by the rule set, which is a modification of the rule set from the fantasy RPG Khelataar. The rest of the book describes the setting, focusing on the Nordic regions and parts of Germany.

72532.name: V-Saturn
72532.description:
User Summary

An official Sega Saturn produced by Victor Japan (JVC). To separate it from the originally black Sega Saturn and the white Saturn released in 1996, the V-Saturn was gray and came with gray controllers. Nothing separated it from the Sega Saturn apart from the starting logo and the case colour. It was ever only released in Japan.

It bundled with the JVC game "Vatlva", a car-wars like multiplayer game.

72533.name: AV Family Computer
72533.description:
User summary and from Japanese Wikipedia:

Also known as the New Famicom, this was released in 1993 as a Famicom that could be plugged into a TV's RCA composite video input instead of the antenna: it used the same output as the SFC (and later N64), allowing the same cable to be used. It also addressed the original Famicom's problem of having hard-wired controllers that could not be removed from the set. The console came with two controllers.

It is design-wise next to identical to the NES2 (NES-101 Control Deck) but the NES2 didn't have an RCA output.

72535.description:
Game Play Description

Exile Sun combines some of the most compelling strategic mechanics in a way that delivers a streamlined, integrated, and fast-paced game of competition and conflict. Simplified deck building, hand management, simultaneous hidden worker placement, a card draft, 6 unique player advantages, and a revolutionary zero-luck combat resolution system ensure that playing Exile Sun is like no other game. Private and public card-based objectives give players options for points, but they must choose carefully when allocating their limited resources. The player with the most points accumulated at the end of three game cycles wins.

A Game Round

The game simply consists of cycles where each player in turn makes four fleet moves and then ends their turn by moving a pawn on the 'Timer Track'. The 'Timer Track' triggers events like 'Supply' and 'Battle' that effect all players simultaneously. Once each event is resolved, the player turns continue.


Moves - These moves can be regular movement, scanning an enemy fleet, launching a decoy fleet, and initiating a battle.
Events - The battle and supply events are resolved with a mechanic that may be best described as simultaneous hidden worker placement. This unique mechanic involves the use of a control card with 10 sliding tabs. The resulting game play is tense, intuitive, and intensely competitive.





Theme Overview

Far off and forgotten, orbiting the Exile star, a fragmented group of Colonial powers is struggling to exist in the harsh environment of their foreign home. Having been unexpectedly cut off from contact with Earth over two hundred years ago, the process of gaining some economic recovery has been slow and arduous. With dissension rising among the populace, these leaders must compete to gain military, economic, and technological advantages over each other in a race to lead the united colonies in a mission to contact Earth. Time is short. While an outright planetary assault could express dominance in military power, perhaps luring out and destroying an opposing Flagship or Construction Shipyard can have the same effect using fewer resources. Or hit and run assaults with fleets of strike craft can be equally effective. But be warned, leaders dare not neglect their own colony resources, or their supporters will lose faith in them and they’ll fall quickly out of the race.
72535.name: Exile Sun

72538.name: Balloon Kid
72538.description:
[User Summary]

Balloon Kid is a platform game (more of a flying game, really) produced by Gunpei Yokoi, creator of Metroid and the Game Boy. It is a sequel to the NES game Balloon Fight.

The gameplay is similar to its predecessor's, but instead of a single-screen, Joust-like game; the player explores several automatically scrolling levels. This game is one of few side scrolling games which scroll exclusively to the left (Balloon Fight's Balloon Trip mode is another).

There have been two ports made of this game, one for the Japanese Family Computer and one for the Game Boy Color. The Famicom game stars Hello Kitty and has a larger play area, while the Game Boy Color game is mostly unchanged other than the addition of color and a save feature. These were only published in Japan, while the original Balloon Kid was only released in the US and Europe.

72539.name: Races & Cultures
72539.description:
From the publisher website:

Created for RMFRP and Shadow World, the new Races & Cultures gives you everything you need to design unique, exciting and diverse characters for you Rolemaster and Shadow World adventures. Races & Cultures is divided into two main sections on races and cultures so you can mix and match! Included are all the core races as well as many humanoid (including centaurs), and fey races (like the Dwelf and the Pech).

Also included are unusual races from Creatures & Monsters, and the monster races as well

72540.description:
They said hello by destroying the moon. Tides ceased to exists and wave after wave of dead fish washed up on shores the world over. You will never know the pleasure of walking in the surf during a lazy summer vacation, bug. I'm so sorry for that.

In the midst of the panic over the moon they appeared. We tried to fight back but they destroyed our biggest weapons in their silos. Governments and world leaders responded in different ways. Some gave up instantly, and others resisted. The beach, bug, remember what I told you about that? It used to be a lot farther away, but that was before they made an example of it. All in all, it was a hell of a way to find out that we were not alone.

That was about 15 years ago. Since then, we've had some victories, but far too many failures. The biggest op your daddy was involved in was faking the crash on Mars a few years back. See, bug, we WANTED that ship to take heavy fire and crash, right where it did. There were enough diggers aboard to set up the underground Mars base. Last time daddy was there he got to see a new weapon, based on their tech. Hopefully we can have it ready soon.

This is why I have to go, bug. Mars needs people like me to sneak in, hide in the Moon belt, deliver supplies and workers, and get back home without being seen. And I promise you that one day I will take you to see the rings of Saturn, when we can fly throughout the system safely and freely. It'll be just you and me. I should be back soon. I will miss my little bug, bunches and bunches! Daddy will always l-

END TRANSMISSION

In SNEAK, players take on the role of heroic smugglers looking to transport supplies up to the secret Resistance base on Mars. On each turn, you will have an amount of energy (action points) that you can use to maneuver and move your ship around the board. However, any leftover energy is converted in cargo cards, that you draw into hand. Asteroids will then semi-randomly move around the board, blocking your way or revealing your hiding space. Then, the aliens will move and attempt to destroy you. Each time you get hit by an alien you will have to lose cargo cards- or else you will have to start your smuggling run again. Upon a successful run, you will score notoriety points based on the cargo you brought and can spend it to increase your maximum energy, maximum cargo (hand size), and number of special powers (mods), or to buy new mods.
The most notorious smuggler at the end of 10 rounds is the winner!
72540.name: SNEAK: Smugglers Nimbly Evading Alien Killers

72544.name: The Burning Wheel: Adventure Burner
rpghonor: 2010 Golden Geek Best RPG Supplement Nominee
2011 Golden Geek Best RPG Supplement Nominee
72544.description:
From the back cover:


Adventure: What we consider adventure, some call hardship, pain and certain death. The privation, the politics, the bloody fights all take their toll, but it is only when we struggle that we truly live. We fight to overcome. We deal for gain. We suffer for glory.


The Adventure Burner is the third supplement for The Burning Wheel Fantasy Roleplaying System. It provides a system for setting up and running sessions, adventures, and campaigns. Examples are provided in the form of three ready-to-run scenarios — The Sword, Trouble in Hochen, and Thelon’s Rift — and 42 sample characters.

In addition, this volume provides extensive insight into the Burning Wheel system. 150 pages of commentary guide the reader through the game and its application in play. A handful of new and clarified rules complete the book.

These assets make the Adventure Burner an invaluable resource for neophytes and haggard veterans alike.

72549.name: She, the Ultimate Weapon
72549.description:
User summary:

A PS2 game based on the comic book and animated television series carrying the same name. The Japanese title means "Ultimate Weapon Girlfriend". It's the love story between a tall but sociallly clumsy high school boy and a very timid, physically weak and short girl. Before long, it turns out that the girl, Chise, has gone through a military top secret experiment and has been turned into the Ultimate Weapon; when danger looms, she reacts instantly and instinctively, produces metal mech parts out of her body, can fly and fire all sorts of weapons. Chise has only limited control over these functions.

The game is an interactive fiction adventure, where the player goes through the comic book story step by step in simple game scenes.

72551.name: Dawn of Mana
videogamehonor: 2006 Japan Game Awards Best Unreleased Game Winner
72551.description:
User summary:

Originally carrying the title "Seiken Densetsu 4", Dawn of Mana is the fourth (main) installment in the Seiken Densetsu (Mana) series, and part of the "Mana revival" in 2006.

While the famous Seiken Densetsu 2 (Secret of Mana, 1993, SNES) was an action RPG with a multiplayer co-op function, and Seiken Densetsu 3 (1995) and the PSX game Legend of Mana (1999) both imitated the three-character party system, Dawn of Mana is a 1-player game only, and focusing more on the action aspect. Instead of just attacking the enemies on screen, the player is supposed to pick up things and throw at them, stunning them temporarily and then attack. The game is in full 3D.

72552.name: Melty Blood: Act Cadenza
72552.description:
User summary:

Melty Blood: Act Cadenza is an arcade game based on the characters from the game Melty Blood, a home-made visual novel/fighting game by the home-made game developpers Watanabe and Type-moon. Melty Blood was a sequel to the immensely popular visual novel "Tsukihime" by Type-moon.

The arcade fighting game was released in march 2005 and ported to the Playstation 2 in August 2006, with some fixed balance issues.

72554.description:
El Stadler is an expansion for El Presidente (the Cuba expansion). It is a single card to be added to the other Cuban-cards. The card was created by Michael Rieneck and designed by Michael Menzel for the anniversary of the author of the base game Stefan Stadler. The card was produced in a micro edition of only 40 cards that were never sold and only available for friends of Eggert-Spiele.

This card allows to remove a ship from the harbor or the one on the sea.
72554.name: Cuba: El Stadler

72555.name: Master Burner
72555.description:
User summary:

An After Burner clone game starring Marisa Kirisame of Project Shrine Maiden fame. Master Burner is a 3D action "rail shooter/maneuver" shooting game, where Marisa is supposed to shoot dwn all that enters on the screen.

It seems it was released in two releases: the Toho Ages 500 release and the Toho Ages 2500 release. The covers differ, but there is no information as to whether the contents differ.

72557.name: Alien Crush
72557.description:
From the US edition manual

"Get Ready for Turbo-charged Pinball Action!

'Alien Crush' is a spellbinding video pinball game combining real, 'turbo-charged' pinball action with far-out alien graphics. Rack up a winning score as you discover all the twists, tricks and hidden bonuses inside the caverns of some of the most outlandish alien worlds you've ever seen. You control the ball speed, flippers, even 'tilt' the board. Nothing can prepare you for this ultimate alien encounter!"

72558.name: Witch Girls Adventures
rpghonor: 2009 Indie RPG Awards - Best Production - Runner Up
72558.description:
Based on the award winning Witch Girls Adventures comic books.

From the back of the book:

What kind of witch are you?

In the world of Witch Girl Adventures, players of all ages can create unique characters and take them on amazing adventures.

They can fly through the air on brooms, turn people into frogs, and learn to control time and space at one of the many schools of magic around the world.

Witch Girls Adventures is an interactive game like no other. it requires no game boards or expensive video game system...Just some friends, paper, dice, and your imagination.

72559.name: Psephology
72559.description:
From the box cover and Rules of Play:

Presidential Campaign Game - Win the election using strategy and knowledge. The object of Psephology (se-fahl-uh-gee) is to be elected the president of the United States. The first candidate to win at least 100 votes and then move to the White House is the winner.

Psephology (from Wikipedia http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Psephology) Psephology (from Greek psephos ψῆφος, 'pebble', which the Greeks used as ballots) is that branch of political science which deals with the study and statistical analysis of elections. Psephology uses compilations of precinct voting returns for elections going back some years, public opinion polls, campaign finance information and similar statistical data. The term was coined in the United Kingdom in 1952 by historian R. B. McCallum to describe the scientific analysis of past elections. In Britain the term occasionally appears in scholarly literature.

The game has 625 cards containing 2500 questions and answers, Power Politics cards, game pieces, dice, a game board and vote cards.

Roll the dice, decide how to move your marker, read the vote bonus/penalty on the board and then attempt to correctly answer a political question to win votes.

Includes rules for 7-12 players and classroom team play, including a timed version.

72560.name: Cranium Junior
72560.description:
Kid Cranium Spongebob Squarepants Edition brings to life the magic of Bikini Bottom through 8 kid-tastic activities. Get acting, puzzling, sketching, sculpting and code-cracking with SpongeBob-themed challenges, earn Bikini Bottom tokens and place four in a row to win. Act out "jellyfish," guess which sea creature has the most arms, sculpt "spatula" and more!

Packed 300 SpongeBob-themed cards, SpongeBob Decoder Goggles and cool Krabby Patty Clay.

Note: there was a version available in Ireland/UK without the Spongebob branding (similar to the German edition shown).

Publisher's Website

72561.name: Charge Large
72561.description:
Enjoy Great Credit, Without the Crunch!

In today’s economy, getting and keeping good credit isn’t easy. But now you can take the crunch out of credit with CHARGE LARGE, the game that makes buying, building and even borrowing pay of big!

Travel around the board using cash and your gold credit card to scoop up prime properties. Buy strategically, borrow wisely, and pay back quickly to earn a platinum card. (It also helps to hit the lottery and collect rent!) If you’re the first to have cash, a zero credit balance, and the coveted black credit card, you’ve beaten the credit card blues, and won the game!

72564.name: Stellvia
72564.description:
User summary:

An interactive fiction adventure game based on the television animation carrying the same name. The player is supposed to wander around on the Stellvia space station and interact with the characters. Depending on how much the player is liked by the different characters, the story will take different routes.

72565.name: Tales of Destiny 2
videogamefranchise: The Best (Best Selling PlayStation Games, JP)
videogamehonor: 2001–2002 Japan Game Awards Best Unreleased Game Winner
72565.description:
User summary (details from Wikipedia):

From the box back:
18 years after the events in Tales of Destiny, this is the fateful story of Stan's and Lutie's son Kyle.

Tales of Destiny 2 is a direct sequel to the events in the PSX game Tales of Destiny. It was never released in the West, but is easily confused with Tales of Eternia (PSX) which was called Tales of Destiny II in the West (because of the Mattel license of the name Eternia). In fact, Destiny 2 is the fourth game in the Tales of series, Eternia being the third.

The package says a 1-player game, but it acknowledges a multi-tap use, which implies that the game, like the earlier games in the series, allows for cooperative play in the battle scenes.

The character design is done by Mutsumi Inomata, like in Destiny and Eternia.

The game was ported to the PPS in 2006.

Source: Wikipedia, "Tales_of_Destiny_2," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Individual credits:
Mutsumi Inomata: Character design

72566.name: Monopoly: The Simpsons Electronic Banking Edition
72566.description:
The whole town is up for sale! Now you can build your Springfield empire without the hassle of carrying loads of cash especially when it’s in the millions! Things have moved on in Springfield and, just like in the real world, all you need to do is swipe your bank card to transfer your money it couldn’t be easier. Whether you are Homer, Lisa, or Mr. Burns, get ready to wheel and deal the stakes are higher than ever before! It’s the fast-dealing property trading game that features Simpsons characters and properties!

Use cards, not cash store your millions on your bank card!

Includes gameboard, 1 banker unit, 6 Simpsons movers (Bart, Homer, Lisa, Marge, Mr. Burns and Krusty), 28 Title Deed cards, 16 Chance cards, 16 Community Chest cards, 6 MONOPOLY bank cards, 32 yellow houses, 12 red hotels, 2 dice and instructions.

72567.name: Орки идут!
72567.description:
Children’s game about humans, dwarves and orcs. Humans and dwarves lived in peace when the tribes of malicious orcs came and started to assault the civilians. Then humans entered into alliance with dwarves and began to protect their homes.

The alliance’s goal is to destroy all the enemies, while the orcs are to do the same with their opponents. (From the rulebook)

boardgamehonor: 2008 Årets Spill Best Children's Game Nominee
72568.name: Øisteins tegnespill
72568.description: On each turn a card is flipped. The card shows a small drawing that is a part of one of the figures on the board. The first player who finds the figure that is shown draws one of the cards on his/her hand and follows the instructions. Each instructions adds to the players drawing. The first player who draws all his/her cards is the winner.

72569.name: Experimental Technical Readout: Mercs
72569.description:
From the publisher:

The Engineers’ Playground

As the Inner Sphere reels from the devastating Jihad, factories have been shattered and supply lines strained. As the collective might of the Inner Sphere’s military industries rally to the cause, technicians plying the wreckage of a thousand battles across the war-ravaged realms scramble to piece together new weapons for the fight against the Word of Blake. Armed with prototype weapons and equipment rushed to the front lines, a new age of experimental BattleMechs, vehicles, and fighters dawns.

Experimental Technical Readout: Mercs highlights a sample of the prototype designs that have begun testing in the BattleTech universe during the Jihad. Each design featured in this book incorporates some of the latest technologies to debut in the war against the Word of Blake, as first described in Tactical Operations. Statistics and Record Sheets are included for 13 new experimental BattleMechs, vehicles, and fighters, ready for play in advanced BattleTech games.

72570.name: Star Talk
72570.description:
You know the stars - but do you know their secrets? Gossip around celebrities and gamers rule the game.Star Talk is a fascinating mix of quiz and psychology. Answer questions from different categories about various celebrities.

From the back of the German version:

"Sie kennen die Stars - aber kennen Sie auch deren Geheimnisse? Klatsch und Tratsch rund um Berühmtheiten und auch rund um die Mitspieler bestimmen das Spiel. Star Talk ist eine faszinierende Mischung aus Quiz und Psychologie. So ganz nebenbei entdecken Sie Ihr eigenes Star Potential! Sichern Sie sich die begehrtesten Trophäen und Auszeichnungen beim Run auf die Position des ""Superstars""! Beantworten Sie einfach Fragen aus verschiedenen Kategorien auf Ihrem Weg .......

72572.name: ...And One for All!
72572.description:
...And One for All is a free skirmish miniatures game made for use with Three Musketeers miniatures.

From the publisher's website:

The object of ...And One For All! is to recreate the feel of swashbuckling films such as the 1970’s "Three Musketeers". It does this by encouraging you to perform swashbuckling actions about the table with your figures. The more actions a figure makes, the more dice it rolls in combat!

72573.name: World Class Baseball
videogameversion: Japanese TurboGrafx-16 All Star Contest edition
72573.description:
From the US manual

"Let's Play Ball!

Get ready for the most sensational video baseball game ever! World Class Baseball lets you apply virtually all of your baseball skills and knowledge in this classic game of hit and run.

Begin by choosing among 12 different teams. Turbocharged action lets you play against a friend (with optional TurboTap accessory) or take on the computer. Then choose your pitcher. Bunt, throw curves, throw fast balls, catch your man off base, even call in relief pitchers. You'll always know 'who's on first' as World Class Baseball keeps track of batting averages and other vital statistics. Watch as your batting and fielding techniques improve with practice. Apply game-winning strategies. Hear the roar of the crowd--the crack of the bat. World Class Baseball is bound to provide you with hours of world-class enjoyment in a true big-league environment. All set? Then, 'batter up!'"

72574.name: Deadly Premonition
72574.description:
"Deadly Premonition, known as Red Seeds Profile in Japan, is a survival horror video game developed by Access Games and published by Ignition Entertainment for the Xbox 360.

The game gives the player control of a FBI agent named Francis York Morgan who is investigating the murder of a young woman, Anna Graham, near the fictional American town of Greenvale (its containing state is never identified, but it appears to be somewhere in the Pacific Northwest). Upon arriving in the town York is greeted by town sheriff George Woodman and his deputy Emily Wyatt, who brief him on the murder and lead him to the crime scene. York generates considerable friction with his dismissive attitude toward the locals, bizarre demeanor, and tendency to interrupt conversations to deliver asides to "Zach", an alternate personality congruent with the player. Over the course of his investigation, York has opportunities to touch the lives of many of the town's colorful personalities and intervene in their personal crises, often brought on by the sudden and brutal murder in their midst, to earn rewards and further his understanding of the case. As he unearths more and more mysteries and the killer continues to roam, the town's dark past slowly comes to light.

Deadly Premonition's plot and setting are strongly influenced by the American television show Twin Peaks, and numerous allusions and thematic links can be found within the game."

Source: Wikipedia, "Deadly_Premonition," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

72575.name: Hunny Hopp
72575.description:
From the back of the game box:
"An exciting, fast-paced game with Winnie the Pooh and his fiends. If you are lucky with the dice, you'll win the race to the honey pot!"

Players each race along separate six-space boards to the honey pot at the centre, taking turns in rolling a custom die to progress. The die has four different faces (three Pooh Bears, one Tigger, one Piglet and one Eeyore).

Pooh moves the player's piece one space forward. Eeyore moves you back one space. Tigger turns your board around, so that a piece one space from the end is now one from the beginning. Piglet makes everyone pass their board to the player on their left.

The first player to reach the honey pot wins. Because of the effect of Piglet, the piece that reaches the honey pot may not be the one that started with.

72576.name: Catch A Pizza
72576.description:
From A publisher:
Come on in, to the new PIZZA RESTAURANT. Waiters and Waitresses rushing around to serve the customers as quickly as possible with delicious pizzas.
But it won't be as easy as it seems, because over some time, the oven will explode and the pizzas are flying around everywhere. try to catch them.

Object of the game:
The first player to catch 4 pizzas in his pan is the WINNER!

Content:
1 plastic Pizza Restaurant
16 pizzas
4 pizza pans
4 waiters
1 game board (4 pieces)
1 standard die

How to play:
Each player gets one pan and waiter in one color. Then choose the starting player.
the starting player will roll the dice and move accordingly. When you step on a yellow arrow, roll again. When you step on a red square, pass the turn to your left. When you step on the pizza, add one pizza to the oven. And when you step on to the explosion square, then place your pawn on to the kitchen corrior and then set off the waiter. Then you have about 2 second before the oven explodes and the pizzas that are in there, will fly around the room. Catch any pizza into your pan and keep it.
Get 4 pizzas and win!

72577.name: The Sims
videogamefranchise: Platinum Range (Best Selling PlayStation Games, PAL)
Player's Choice (Best Selling Nintendo Games, US & EU)
videogameexpansion: The Sims: Expansion Collection: Volume One
The Sims: Expansion Collection: Volume Three
The Sims: Expansion Collection: Volume Two
videogamehonor: 1999 Game Critics Best Simulation Game of the Year Nominee (Non-Combat)
2000 D.I.C.E. Best Art Direction of the Year Nominee
2000 D.I.C.E. Best Family Game of the Year Nominee (Computer)
2000 D.I.C.E. Best Game Design of the Year Winner
2000 D.I.C.E. Best Gameplay Engineering of the Year Winner
2000 D.I.C.E. Game of the Year Winner
2001 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Innovation of the Year Nominee
2001 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Programming of the Year Winner
2001 Game Developers Choice Awards Game of the Year Winner
72577.description:
"The Sims is a strategic life-simulation computer game developed by Maxis and published by Electronic Arts. It was created by game designer Will Wright, also known for developing SimCity. It is a simulation of the daily activities of one or more virtual persons ("Sims") in a suburban household near SimCity.

The Sims was first released on February 4, 2000 (one day before Chinese New Year). By March 22, 2002, The Sims had sold more than 6.3 million copies worldwide, making it the best-selling PC game in history; the game has shipped 16 million copies worldwide as of February 7, 2005. Since its initial release, seven expansion packs and sequels, The Sims 2 and the new sequel The Sims 3 (each with their own expansion packs), have been released. The Sims has won numerous awards, including GameSpot's "Game of the Year Award" for 2000."

Source: Wikipedia, "The_Sims," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

72578.name: Mercenary's Handbook 3055
72578.description:
From the back cover:

Running a merc unit is a serious business first, last, and always. Not just any group of gung-ho 'Mech jocks can survive in the cutthroat world of the mercenary, and any MechWarrior who ignores this fact ends up working for someone else, Dispossessed, or dead. Running a successful merc unit takes know-how, skill, careful planning, and sometimes a little luck. If you still think you've got what it takes to pit your skills against the fiercest warriors of the Inner Sphere and beyond, The Mercenary's Handbook: 3055 is for you.

The handbook provides a comprehensive, detailed system for creating, maintaining, and operating a mercenary unit in the Battletech universe, covering every aspect if the mercenary life from combat to salary to medical care.

The Mercenary's Handbook: 3055 also includes detailed briefings on five of the most renowned mercenary units of the Inner Sphere: Wolf's Dragoons, the Kell Hounds, Rhonda Snord's Irregulars, the Gray Death Legion, and the Black Thorns. So what are you waiting for? C-bills and glory await any MechWarrior bold enough to take them. But just remember, the battle's not over until the check clears...

72579.name: Shattered Sphere
72579.description:
From the back cover:

In early 3061, Prince Victor Steiner-Davion returned from the Clan homeworlds triumphant—but to an Inner Sphere that was radically different. The entire Ghost Bear population had relocated to the Inner Sphere; the St. Ives Compact was under siege; Katrina Steiner-Davion was sitting on the throne of New Avalon. Even with the overwhelming threat of the Clan invasion defeated, the Inner Sphere is still poised precariously between peace and war. Who will light the spark that will set BattleMechs marching and worlds aflame once more?

Drawing on information from five scenario packs, seven sourcebooks and more than a dozen novels, Shattered Sphere represents the ultimate guide to the people and places of BattleTech, as seen through the eyes of the characters who live there. Offering a brief, comprehensive history of the universe and an in-depth look at events from the Truce of Tukayid through early 3062, this update is a must for any BattleTech fan. Shattered sphere also includes detailed maps showing the current state of the Inner Sphere and the Clans.

videogamefranchise: Greatest Hits (Best Selling PlayStation Games, US)
Platinum Range (Best Selling PlayStation Games, PAL)
Xbox Classics (Best Selling Xbox 360 Games, PAL)
72580.description:
[User Summary]

Resident Evil 5 is a third person shooter survival horror game; it is the seventh release in the main Resident Evil series. Players can take on the role of either Chris Redfield or Sheva Alomar as they fight their way through the zombie-like Majini and try to stop the bio-terrorist threat in Kijuju, Africa. The game may be played co-operatively either locally or on-line.

DLC has been released which adds a 4 person on-line multiplayer modes where players fight each other as well as the Majini in team or free-for-all scenarios.
videogamehonor: 2005 Golden Joystick Most Wanted Game Next Year Winner
2008 Game Critics Best Action/Adventure Game of the Year Nominee
2008 Game Critics Best Console Game of the Year Nominee
2009 Japan Game Awards Game of the Year Winner
2010 D.I.C.E. Best Art Direction of the Year Nominee
72580.name: Resident Evil 5

72582.name: Castlevania III: Dracula's Curse
72582.description:
"Castlevania III: Dracula's Curse​ (悪魔城伝説, Akumajō Densetsu,? "The Legend of the Devil's Castle") is the third and final Castlevania video game produced for the Nintendo Entertainment System.

The plot of Castlevania III: Dracula's Curse is a prequel to the original Castlevania (much like the earlier Game Boy game Castlevania: The Adventure) set a few centuries before the events of the original game. The game's protagonist is Trevor C. Belmont, an ancestor of the original hero Simon Belmont.

Castlevania III abandons the adventure game elements of its immediate predecessor and returns to the platform game roots of the first Castlevania title. Unlike Castlevania, however, Castlevania III is not strictly linear: Trevor, the main character, can be assisted by one of three possible assistant characters, and after completing the first level, and at several other points throughout the game, the player is given a choice of paths to follow. The choices made by the player in these circumstances can have a profound impact on how the game unfolds. There are 15 stages in total.

Castlevania III was the first game to use Konami's VRC6 chip, which is included in the cartridge to provide the console more capabilities. The VRC6 chip primarily added three audio channels to the system--allowing the game to use eight audio channels--as well as provide smoother animation for sprites. The game's audio programmer, Hidenori Maezawa, assisted in the chip's creation. The North American release replaced the VRC6 with Nintendo's Memory Management Controller (MMC) chip, specifically the MMC5 model. The MMC5 chip lacked the extra audio channels, and the game's music had to be downgraded to comply with the NES's standard five channels."

Source: Wikipedia, "Castlevania_III:_Dracula's_Curse," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

72585.name: Landser
72585.description: Free set of World War II skirmish rules focused on squad vs squad level combat designed by Nick Eyre. The game is aimed primarily at 25/28mm, but 15mm works fine. Each soldier can perform a variety of different actions which are listed in his profile. Actions include Move, Move Fast, Move and Fire, Sneak, Fire, Hide, Assault, Covering Fire, Weapon Work and Rally. The rules are simple yet realistic. The game is divided into turns with players taking alternate turns with all of their units. The latest set of rules include many optional rules that have been added by the Landser Yahoo Group including basic armor rules and additional army lists.

videogamefranchise: Greatest Hits (Best Selling PlayStation Games, US)
Platinum Hits (Best Selling Xbox 360 Games, US)
Xbox Classics (Best Selling Xbox 360 Games, PAL)
videogamecompilation: Bioshock & The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion (Double Pack)
videogame: Bioshock & The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion (Double Pack)
72586.description:
From the back of the case (US Xbox 360 edition)

BioShock is a shooter unlike any you've ever played, loaded with weapons and tactics never seen. You'll have a complete arsenal at your disposal from simple revolvers to grenade launchers and chemical throwers, but you'll also be forced to genetically modify your DNA to create an even more deadly weapon: you. Injectable plasmids give you super human powers: blast electrical currents into water to electrocute multiple enemies, or freeze them solid and obliterate them with the swing of a wrench.

No encounter ever plays out the same, and no two gamers will play the game the same way.
videogamehonor: 2006 Game Critics Best Action/Adventure Game of the Year Nominee
2006 Game Critics Best Console Game of the Year Nominee
2006 Game Critics Best of Show Nominee
2006 Game Critics Most Original Game of the Year Nominee
2007 EGM Game of the Year Winner
2007 EGM Platinum Game Winner
2007 Game Critics Best Action/Adventure Game of the Year Winner
2007 Game Critics Best Console Game of the Year Nominee
2007 Game Critics Best of Show Nominee
2007 Game Critics Game of the Year Winner
2007 Game Critics Most Original Game of the Year Nominee
2007 Spike Best Graphics of the Year Nominee
2007 Spike Best Original Score of the Year Winner
2007 Spike Best PC Game of the Year Nominee
2007 Spike Best Shooter of the Year Nominee
2007 Spike Best Xbox Game of the Year Winner
2007 Spike Game of the Year Winner
2008 British Academy Game Awards Best Art Direction of the Year Nominee
2008 British Academy Game Awards Game of the Year Winner
2008 D.I.C.E. Best Action Game of the Year Nominee
2008 D.I.C.E. Best Art Direction of the Year Winner
2008 D.I.C.E. Best Computer Game of the Year Nominee
2008 D.I.C.E. Best Console Game of the Year Nominee
2008 D.I.C.E. Best Game Design of the Year Nominee
2008 D.I.C.E. Best Innovation of the Year Nominee
2008 D.I.C.E. Best Music Composition of the Year Winner
2008 D.I.C.E. Best Sound Design of the Year Winner
2008 D.I.C.E. Best Story of the Year Winner
2008 D.I.C.E. Game of the Year Nominee
2008 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Audio of the Year Winner
2008 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Design of the Year Nominee
2008 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Narrative of the Year Winner
2008 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Visual Arts of the Year Winner
2008 Game Developers Choice Awards Game of the Year Nominee
2012 Spike Best Game of the Decade Nominee
72586.name: BioShock

72587.name: Möbelrücken, oder: Wie kommt denn der Toaster ins Schlafzimmer?
72587.description:
Möbelrücken, oder: Wie kommt denn der Toaster ins Schlafzimmer? (translation: Furniture Moving, or: How did the toaster get in the bedroom?) was produced by Ravensburger for Ikea, which presumably sold it in their stores at one time.

In the game, players move around a board and collect cards showing items of furniture and accessories (e.g., lamps) which belong in one of four rooms. Having at least three adjacent cards from a single room allows a player to "open" that room, at which point they start moving around a smaller, altered track and have exclusive rights to their room. When someone gets all eight cards for their room the game is over and the winner is the one whose cards are worth the most points.

Additional details include joker cards and the use of a second set of cards to remove furniture from other players' rooms.

72588.name: Descent: Road to Legend Lieutenants – Sir Alric Farrow
72588.description:
From the back of the package:

A mighty Overlord treading the path of legend needs strong leaders to oversee his many minions.

Bring your Road to Legend Lieutenant tokens alive with 3D minis!

Sir Alric Farrow has already died once fighting for what he believes in. Now, he is a simple puppet of the Overlord, and the prospect of dying again does not frighten him...not half as much as he frightens those who cross his path!

Cost: 0.
Avatar: Any Avatar.
Power: DOOM!
Minions: 2 Beastmen, 2 Razorwings, 2 Hell Hounds, 1 Sorcerer.

He begins the campaign in play for free at the Overlord's Keep and has Ironskin, Regeneration 5, and Unstoppable.

72589.name: Panasonic FZ-1 R.E.A.L.  3DO Interactive Multiplayer
72589.description:
The original edition of the console, the FZ-1, was referred to in full as the 3DO REAL Interactive Multiplayer. The console had advanced hardware features at the time: an ARM60 32-bit RISC CPU, two custom video coprocessors, a custom 16-bit DSP and a custom math co-processor. It also featured 2 megabytes of DRAM, 1 megabyte of VRAM, and a double speed CD-ROM drive for main CD+Gs or Photo CDs (and Video CDs with an add-on MPEG video module). The 3DO included the first music visualizer in a game console, converting CD music to a mesmerizing color pattern.

Source: Wikipedia, "3DO Interactive Multiplayer", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

72591.name: Fall of the Philippines: MacArthur's Defeat, 1941
72591.description:
(From Introduction)

This is a solitaire game simulating the Battle for Luzon between Japanese and Allied forces after Pearl Harbor in December, 1941. The player--representing the Allied forces under Gen. Douglas MacArthur--attempts to repulse the Japanese invaders. The game system handles the movement and combat of the Japanese side.

Published in Panzer Digest #9, Summer 2010

72592.name: Panasonic ROBO 3DO
72592.description:
User Summary

A version of the FZ-1 console, sold only in Japan, the ROBO included a 5-disc changer and was aimed at commercial markets, such as the hotel industry, rather than consumers.

72593.name: Goldstar 3DO Interactive Multiplayer
72593.description:
User Summary

Goldstar's version of the 3DO console was viewed as having a better cd-rom drive than Panasonic's FZ-1, but had some hardware differences that prevented some games from running properly on it.

72594.name: Sanyo TRY 3DO Interactive Multiplayer
72594.description:
User Summary

Sanyo's entry in the 3DO console, the TRY was only sold in Japan.

72595.name: 3DO Blaster
72595.description:
User Summary

The 3DO Blaster is an ISA add on card for DOS and Windows 3.1 PC's, which included the core chips of the 3DO console, allowing for play of that console's games on the PC. It would only work when connected to a specific model of Panasonic CD-ROM drive, and utilized the PC's VGA card, along with a compatible SoundBlaster card for video and audio support.

72596.name: 'Nam '68
72596.description:
(from Introduction)

This is a simple game of strategy for two players, simulating man-to-man combat in the jungles of Vietnam in 1968. One player controls US soldiers and one player controls North Vietnamese (NVA) soldiers. There are five scenarios.

Published in Panzer Digest #9, Summer 2010

72597.name: Nintendo DSi
72597.description:
User summary:
The DSi is a revision to the Nintedo DS, adding a pair of digital cameras and software support for their use, and an SD card slot, while removing the GBA cartridge slot.

72598.name: Nintendo DSi XL
72598.description:
User summary:
The DSi XL is a larger version of the Nintendo DSi, coming in at roughly 1.5x the size of the original. It retains all the functionality of the DSi, but has longer battery life due to a larger battery. The larger screen has the same resolution as the smaller system, which can result in some games having a more blocky appearance.

72599.name: Left 4 Dead
videogamefranchise: Xbox Classics (Best Selling Xbox 360 Games, PAL)
videogamehonor: 2008 Game Critics Best Action Game of the Year Nominee
2008 Game Critics Best Online Multiplayer of the Year Winner
2008 Game Critics Best PC Game of the Year Nominee
2008 Game Critics Game of the Year Nominee
2008 Game Critics Most Original Game of the Year Nominee
2008 Spike Best Multiplayer Game of the Year Winner
2008 Spike Best PC Game of the Year Winner
2008 Spike Best Shooter of the Year Nominee
2009 British Academy Game Awards Best Gameplay of the Year Nominee
2009 British Academy Game Awards Best Multiplayer Game of the Year Winner
2009 D.I.C.E. Best Animation of the Year Nominee
2009 D.I.C.E. Best Game Design of the Year Nominee
2009 D.I.C.E. Best Gameplay Engineering of the Year Nominee
2009 D.I.C.E. Best Innovation of the Year Nominee
2009 D.I.C.E. Best Online Gameplay of the Year Winner
2009 D.I.C.E. Computer Game of the Year Winner
2009 D.I.C.E. Game of the Year Nominee
2009 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Audio of the Year Nominee
2009 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Design of the Year Nominee
2009 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Technology of the Year Nominee
2009 Game Developers Choice Awards Game of the Year Nominee
2009 Golden Joystick Best Online Game of the Year Winner
72599.description:
[From the back of the case]:

Four survivors in an epic struggle fighting hordes of swarming zombies. Can you survive the zombie apocalypse?

Winner of many awards, including Best of E3 from Game Informer and more, Left 4 Dead is an intense new action game from Valve, creators of Half-Life, Counter-Strike, Portal, and Team Fortress.

Single player, co-op and multiplayer modes are powered by the "AI Director" which changes the zombies, effects, and more to create a different experience every time you play.

Features 100s of zombies, 20 new maps, 10 new weapons and four sprawling "Movie Campaigns." Plus, Versus Mode—play as the Boss Infected!

72600.name: Left 4 Dead 2
videogamehonor: 2009 Game Critics Best Action Game of the Year Nominee
2009 Game Critics Best Online Multiplayer of the Year Winner
2009 Game Critics Best PC Game of the Year Nominee
2009 Game Critics Game of the Year Nominee
2009 Spike Best Multiplayer Game of the Year Nominee
2009 Spike Best PC Game of the Year Nominee
2009 Spike Best Shooter of the Year Nominee
2009 Spike Best Xbox Game of the Year Winner
2009 Spike Game of the Year Nominee
2010 British Academy Game Awards Best Action Game of the Year Nominee
2010 British Academy Game Awards Best Audio of the Year Nominee
2010 British Academy Game Awards Best Multiplayer Game of the Year Winner
2010 British Academy Game Awards Game of the Year Nominee
2010 D.I.C.E. Action Game of the Year Nominee
2010 D.I.C.E. Best Gameplay Engineering of the Year Nominee
2010 D.I.C.E. Best Online Gameplay of the Year Nominee
2016 Steam Awards Better With Friends Winner
72600.description:
From the developer's website:

Set in the zombie apocalypse Left 4 Dead 2 is a co-operative, action horror, first person shooter that takes you and your friends through the cities, swamps, and cemeteries of the Deep South from Savannah to New Orleans across five expansive campaigns.

You’ll play as one of four new survivors armed with a wide and devastating array of classic and upgraded weapons. In addition to firearms you’ll also get a chance to take out some aggression on infected with a variety of carnage-creating melee weapons from chainsaws to axes and even the deadly frying pan. You’ll be putting these weapons to the test against three horrific and formidable new Special Infected. You’ll also encounter five new "uncommon" common infected including the terrifying Mudmen.

The new AI Director 2.0 has the ability to procedurally change the weather and the pathways you’ll take in addition to tailoring the enemy population, effects, and sounds to match your performance.

72601.name: The Beatles Rock Band
videogamehonor: 2009 Game Critics Best Social/Casual/Puzzle Game of the Year Nominee
2010 British Academy Game Awards Best Family/Children's Game of the Year Nominee
2010 British Academy Game Awards Best Multiplayer Game of the Year Nominee
2010 D.I.C.E. Family Game of the Year Winner
2010 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Audio of the Year Nominee
72601.description:
From the official game website:

Experience The Beatles' music and legacy like never before, using the core Rock Band gameplay. You won't just watch and listen as The Beatles make rock history, create landmark records, and conquer the world—for the first time, you’ll be part of the band!

72602.name: Devil's Crush
72602.description:
From the US TurboGrafx-16 edition's manual

"Devil's Crush--The Ultimate Game of Pinball Action!

'Devil's Crush' is an incredible video pinball game combining 'turbo-charged' action with eerie, underworld graphics. You play in a world cursed by devils. Channel your rage into the Spring of Justice. Attack the monsters' base of operations. Break their evil magic spells and bring light back to this cursed world. You control the ball speed, flippers, even 'tilt' the board, just as you would in a real pinball game. But beware. Because no ordinary pinball game could ever prepare you to meet the devil. Will you win? Or will you be 'crushed' like the others?"

72603.name: Berserk – Millennium Falcon * Holy Demon's War Chapter
72603.description:
User summary:

Berserk for the Playstation 2 is directly based on the story in the manga with a few extra twists. Unlike its game predecessor Berserk – Forgetful flowers for the Dreamcast in 1999, it is not a full side chapter, and is also not a sequel to that game.

While not being a sequel, the game plays largely the same as its predecessor; the player takes the role of Gatts (Guts) as he fights his way through hordes of monsters, clearing stage after stage arcade-style. Points are earned for doing combos: hitting enemy after enemy without break.

As the game advances through the story, the player is treated to some story surprises that did not show up in the manga.

The game was rated CERO-Z (18) and was later, with the strengthening of the ratings in 2006, treated as a game that is illegal to sell to children under 18.

72604.name: TimeSplitters 2
videogamefranchise: Platinum Range (Best Selling PlayStation Games, PAL)
Player's Choice (Best Selling Nintendo Games, US & EU)
videogamehonor: 2003 D.I.C.E. Action Game of the Year Nominee (Console)
2005 British Academy Game Awards Best Audio of the Year Nominee
2005 British Academy Game Awards Best Nintendo Console Game of the Year Nominee
2005 British Academy Game Awards Best PlayStation Game of the Year Nominee
2005 British Academy Game Awards Best Soundtrack of the Year Nominee
2005 British Academy Game Awards Best Xbox Game of the Year Nominee
72604.description:
[From the back of the case (US PS2 edition)]:

Through a rift in space and time, pursue the hideous race known as the TimeSplitters, and eliminate their fiendish schemes to end mankind's future.

Blast through 10 huge environments in time such as a Cold War Russian military base, the gangster-ridden 1920's Chicago and the futuristic surface of Planet X.

An action packed epic story unfolds through multiple objective based missions with superbly animated cut-scenes.

Rage all out war against insurmountable odds, utilizing the most lethal weapons of every era.

Choose from over 100 playable characters to fight with or against in furious Multiplayer mayhem, and with up to 16 players using i-Link.

Create your own single or multiplayer games with the brilliantly simple MapMaker.

72605.name: Monster Manual 3
rpgissuearticle: Des & Dev: MM3 Story and Mechanics
rpgpodcastepisode: Episode 4: a new hope. no not really.
72605.description:
From the publisher's Website:

Iconic monsters for your D&D campaign.

This core rulebook packs in over 200 new monsters to menace D&D player characters. Classic monsters such as the derro, the mimic, and Lolth (Demon Queen of Spiders) make their first appearance here. In addition, this book includes scores of new monsters to challenge characters of heroic, paragon, and epic level, including deadly catastrophic dragons!

72606.name: Tieflings
72606.description:
From the Publisher's Website:

New options and character hooks for tiefling characters.

This expansion of the Player’s Handbook core rulebook explores the infernal secrets of the tieflings. It presents D&D players with exciting new options for their tiefling characters, including unique racial feats, powers, paragon paths, and epic destinies. This book also includes ways to flesh out your tiefling character’s background and personality.

72607.name: TimeSplitters: Future Perfect
72607.description:
[From the back of the case (US PS2 edition)]:

Cortez is back and this time he's bringing some friends to help him fight the past in order to change the future.

Fight across multiple time period in Story, Arcade, Co-op, and Multiplayer modes.

8-player online multiplayer battles—choose from 16 maps or create your own.

Arm yourself with a massive arsenal of weapons from the past, present, and future.

Innovative time travel gameplay lets you team up with your past or future self and be your own ally.

72608.name: Microvision
72608.description:
User summary, details from Wikipedia

The original Microvision console had two slots for 9-volt batteries and was built to play cartridges with either Intel 8021 or Texas Instruments TMS1100 processors (the cartridges for the Microvision were made with the processor built into them, the console itself had no CPU). After troubles with shorting and overheating of improperly inserted batteries, and after discontinuing use of the Intel processor, a second version of the Microvision was released which ran on a single battery.

72614.name: ModNation Racers
videogamehonor: 2009 Game Critics Best Racing Game of the Year Nominee
2010 CVA Most Anticipated Game Next Year Winner
2010 Spike Best Driving Game of the Year Nominee
2010 Spike Best PlayStation Game of the Year Nominee
2011 CVA Best Game Innovation of the Year Winner
2011 D.I.C.E. Racing Game of the Year Nominee
72614.description:
[From the back cover]:

"A kart racer for a new generation.
Race against friends on a track that YOU built.
Race!
Over 25 outrageous tracks with realistic physics and upgradeable power ups!
Offline 4 player split screen and 12 player online.
Create!
Unlimited personalization of your driver and customization of your kart.
Sculpt the terrain. Add banks or tunnels. Place power-ups, ramps and short-cuts.
Build your dream track in minutes.
Share!
Share your creations and download other tracks.
Remix and play unlimited player generated content!"

72615.name: Æon Flux
72615.description:
"Æon Flux is the video game adaptation of the 2005 science fiction film of the same name, with elements of the Æon Flux cartoon series. The game was released on November 15, 2005 in North America for the PlayStation 2 and Xbox gaming consoles. The development cycle of the Aeon Flux game was ten months, a relatively short time for a non-sequel console game."

Source: Wikipedia, "Æon_Flux_(video_game)," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

72616.name: Advent Rising
72616.description:
